question_text: What is the purpose of an operating system?
What is virtual memory in an operating system?
option_a: A) It is a type of memory used for virtual machines
option_b: B) It allows programs to use more memory than is actually available
option_c: C) It is a memory storage device used in cloud computing
option_d: D) It is a type of memory used for video processing

question_text: Which scheduling algorithm provides the highest average turnaround time?
What is a deadlock in operating systems?
option_a: A) It is a situation where a process is waiting indefinitely for resources held by other processes
option_b: B) It is a situation where two processes are waiting for each other to release resources, causing both to wait indefinitely
option_c: C) It is a situation where a process terminates unexpectedly
option_d: D) It is a situation where the operating system crashes

question_text: What is the purpose of the "fork" system call in Unix-like operating systems?
option_a: A) To create a new process
option_c: C) To wait for a child process to finish
option_d: D) To execute a command in the shell

question_text: What is a kernel in operating systems?
option_a: A) It is the central processing unit (CPU)
option_b: B) It is the part of the operating system responsible for managing hardware resources
option_c: C) It is the part of the operating system responsible for user interface
option_d: D) It is a type of file system

question_text: What is a page fault in operating systems?
option_a: A) It occurs when a page in memory is accessed for the first time
option_b: B) It occurs when a page in memory is accessed and is not currently loaded in RAM
option_c: C) It occurs when a page in memory is corrupted
option_d: D) It occurs when a page in memory is locked by another process

question_text: What is the purpose of the "chmod" command in Unix-like operating systems?
option_a: A) To change the modification time of a file
option_b: B) To change the ownership of a file
option_c: C) To change the permissions of a file
option_d: D) To change the file type

question_text: What is a semaphore in operating systems?
option_a: A) It is a type of memory
option_b: B) It is a synchronization primitive used to control access to shared resources
option_c: C) It is a type of file system
option_d: D) It is a hardware component

question_text: What is the purpose of the "grep" command in Unix-like operating systems?
option_a: A) To search for files containing specific text
option_b: B) To list all files in a directory
option_c: C) To copy files from one directory to another
